image.altText: A tight head and shoulders shot of Senator Linda Reynolds looking at the camera outside court.

props.synopsis: Brittany Higgins's legal team rejects claims Linda Reynolds's former staffer chose the senator to be the "villain" in her story of a political cover up.

title.children: Senator's defamation action 're-traumatising' for Brittany Higgins, high-stakes trial told

props.synopsis: Security authorities believe the chances of a violent extremist act are now more likely than when authorities lowered the alert level to "possible" in November 2022.

title.children: ASIO lifts terror threat level to 'probable' amid heightened tensions over war in Gaza

image.altText: A girl with brown hair and wearing a pink sweater walks through a home carrying a cardboard box.

props.synopsis: Alison and Amelia moved from the east coast of Australia to Perth to escape homelessness. Now, rising rents out west — even in one of Perth's cheaper suburbs — mean they're facing it again.

title.children: Six years after fleeing rising rents, Alison and Amelia are back where they started

image.altText: A vast expanse of dry outback terrain. A rock formation is visible on the horizon.

props.synopsis: Two men are being treated in Broome Hospital after their light aircraft crashed on the border of Leopold Downs Station, east of Fitzroy Crossing.

title.children: Two men seriously injured after light plane crash in far north WA

image.altText: Bespectacled man stands by a wall and looks into the camera.

props.synopsis: Multiple former Adult and Teen Challenge residents have spoken to the ABC about their concerns. An advocate says the government has known the sector's issues for years.

title.children: Private rehab survivor calls lack of government action on regulation a 'punch in the face'

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair and a black jacket arrives at court

props.synopsis: Day two of the defamation trial between Linda Reynolds and Brittany Higgins saw Ms Higgins' lawyer outline their defence of the allegations. Here's how the day unfolded.

title.children: 'Never been a fairy tale': Brittany Higgins's lawyers pan Linda Reynolds's defamation claims, as it happened

props.synopsis: Newly independent senator Fatima Payman has signalled she plans to use her bargaining power in the Senate to secure funding for local projects in exchange for her vote on contentious government legislation.

title.children: Don't count on my vote, Fatima Payman tells Labor, hinting at appetite to bargain

image.altText: wind farm in paddocks

props.synopsis: As demand for electricity rises, energy companies are stepping in with plans to transform WA pastures into wind farms over the next decade prompting councils to ask for "serious" policies from the state government.

title.children: Farming heartland to become energy hub with more than 260 wind turbines

image.altText: Close-up image of a McDonald's Big Mac burger on light coloured background

props.synopsis: The cost of a Big Mac can help us understand the big picture of what's going on with spiralling prices.

title.children: The price of this burger tells the story of our cost-of-living crisis

image.altText: Four people walk along a footpath in front of the ASX building on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: After experiencing what analysts call a "Goldilocks scenario", Australian stocks just suffered their biggest fall since the pandemic lockdown era and global financial markets are nervous.

title.children: Australia's 'Goldilocks scenario' is over with a $100 billion fall. It's hard to tell what happens now

image.altText: Luke Willian of Australia leads triathletes during the run leg of the mixed relay at the Paris Olympics.

props.synopsis: Australia's triathletes return to the River Seine for the mixed relay, before the Hockeyroos' Olympic dream goes on the line against China. Follow live.

title.children: Mixed triathlon kicks off day 10 in Paris, before Hockeyroos face knockout clash

image.altText: A woman carries a yellow folder with two other women beside her.

props.synopsis: Kerry Dare told the triple-0 operator there had been two big bangs and her husband was going to investigate.  When the operator called back, Ms Dare's husband was already dead.

title.children: Triple-0 operator apologised for delay in calling back wife of man murdered at Wieambilla, inquest hears

image.altText: Hawthorn Hawks signage at the clubs headquarters in Melbourne

props.synopsis: Specific details of allegations against the Hawthorn Football Club have been outlined in court, with Indigenous ex-players claiming they were subjected to a "racist culture" and told to abandon plans to have families.

title.children: Court documents detail specific allegations from former players on club's 'racist culture'

image.altText: A group of three Olympic medals - with silver, gold and bronze left to right - are shown against a dark background.

props.synopsis: Keep up with how many medals Aussie athletes have won today — and where Australia sits on the leaderboard.

title.children: Here's the medal standings for day 10 of the Olympic Games

image.altText: Adelaide researcher Dr Michael Taylor has found legionella bacteria can live on their own

props.synopsis: Victorian health authorities are confident they have located and treated the source of a deadly legionnaires' outbreak in Melbourne.

title.children: Victorian health authorities confident they've 'identified and treated' source of legionnaires' outbreak

image.altText: Noah Lyles roars with delight while holding up an American flag

props.synopsis: The shortest race, an indeterminable wait, the finest margin of victory. The men's 100m final at the Paris Olympics stretched and bent time into an impossible puzzle that only Noah Lyles could solve.

title.children: The shortest race and the longest of glories — how a brash American bent time to claim 100m Olympic gold

image.altText: A red Bendigo Bank sign.

props.synopsis: Accessing banking services in the Pacific is difficult, and it could soon become worse.

title.children: Australian banks are getting out of the Pacific. It threatens economies and livelihoods

image.altText: Two people stand atop a rowboat celebrating.

props.synopsis: After 86 days of isolation on the water, Fanch Landron and his partner Sophie Bernier reach Reunion Island in their bright pink rowboat.

title.children: Couple navigate bad weather, sharks and isolation to complete epic row across Indian Ocean

image.altText: McCarthy speaks in front of a row of microphones.

props.synopsis: Malarndirri McCarthy, the new minister for Indigenous Australians, says the prime minister's words were misinterpreted and the government has not ditched its promise to implement the Uluru Statement from the Heart in full.

title.children: 'Not what I heard': New Indigenous Australians minister says government has not abandoned Makarrata promise

image.altText: Phillip Martens stands in a group of rebels who are all holding riles and bow and arrows.

props.synopsis: A spokesperson for a separatist group holding a New Zealand pilot hostage in Indonesia's Papua region say they plan to release him in August or September.

title.children: Armed rebels holding NZ pilot hostage for 18 months again pledge to release him

image.altText: A green and purple toned portrait of a middle-aged man on a canvas cloth hung on a fence

props.synopsis: The family of Marc Fogel say they are devastated the US schoolteacher detained in Russia did not come home in the latest prisoner swap orchestrated by the Biden administration.

title.children: The teacher left behind in the Russian-US prisoner swap

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has posted another loss, down 3.7 per cent in what is the index's worst two-day performance since 2022. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX closes down 3.7 pc in worst two-day performance since 2022

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX fall accelerates in the afternoon session
ASX down 2.9% heading into afternoon session

image.altText: Four men in black and white against a blue gradient background

props.synopsis: Once decided, her VP pick will join her on a tour of multiple battleground states across the US ahead of the Democratic National Convention.

title.children: Kamala Harris is just days away from a battleground tour with her vice-president pick. Here's who's still in the running

image.altText: A composite of three athletes.

props.synopsis: Severe illness leads Belgium to pull its triathletes out of their next event and a boxer makes history for the refugee team. Here are some moments you may have missed overnight in Paris.

title.children: Olympic quick hits: Belgian triathletes pull out, swim star sleeps in a park, and refugee boxer makes history

image.altText: A city late at night with three streaks of light going up in the air.

props.synopsis: Tensions have been soaring in recent days following the death of Ismail Haniyeh, the leader of Hamas.

title.children: US and its allies race to ease tensions in the Middle East amid more Israeli strikes in Gaza

image.altText: Eleanor Patterson, of Australia, competes in the women's high jump final at the 2024

props.synopsis: What is an NR? Who is the fastest man in the world? Your burning questions about Olympic athletics answered.

title.children: What you need to know about Olympic athletics ahead of tonight's jam-packed schedule of Australians

image.altText: Nic Porter screams

props.synopsis: Who's winning the Paris Olympics? US researchers say it's not as simple as counting medals and are developing a new system to promote fairness between big and small countries at the Games. Can you guess who comes out on top?

title.children: Is there a better way to rank Olympic success?

image.altText: Beef mince packaged in plastic.

props.synopsis: Australia exported nearly 130,000 tonnes of beef in July, which is a record month for the industry.

title.children: In this Olympic year, Australia's beef industry just broke a record

image.altText: Opals wrap

props.synopsis: The Opals manage to beat France by enough to avoid an early meeting with the USA, the Kookaburras are knocked out, and the Stingers keep on winning. Here's everything you need to know about the Australian teams overnight.

title.children: Opals move on and avoid early meeting with the US, as Kookaburras exit and Stingers win again

image.altText: Rob De Castella

props.synopsis: Rob De Castella faced a rollercoaster of a career, including a gut-wrenching dip at the Los Angeles Olympics — but the marathon icon has created a legacy that's bigger than the sport.

title.children: 'Embrace the struggle': How a burly Aussie became an athletics icon and changed the face of the marathon

image.altText: A close-up of an indigenous man with a painted face and his eyes closed.

props.synopsis: The Garma Festival is the best chance many Australians get to experience the rich culture of the Yolŋu, and the vibrant beauty of their land.

title.children: The Garma Festival is awash with opportunities for a photographer. These are our favourites

image.altText: Police commissioner hugs indigenous woman after apologising for NT police failure

props.synopsis: The NT police commissioner's historic apology at Garma has been cautiously welcomed by Aboriginal peak bodies, but it's deepened the rift between the police union and the executive.

title.children: NT police commissioner's Garma apology hailed as a 'new dawning'

image.altText: Two women stand in front of a white wall

props.synopsis: Plus Aerosmith make "heartbreaking and difficult" decision to retire from touring — and other entertainment news you might have missed.

title.children: Charli xcx and Billie Eilish make streaming history with Guess remix

image.altText: A shot of a busy Melbourne street with pedestrians in front of a tram.

props.synopsis: Expectations the Reserve Bank is likely to keep rates on hold will be of little relief to mortgage holders. Here are the simple, brutal numbers behind why people are hurting.

title.children: These are the simple, brutal numbers that explain why households are doing it tough right now

image.altText: Nicolaas Bester, Grace Tame's childhood abuser, leaves court in Hobart.

props.synopsis: Nicolaas Ockert Bester was charged with a cybercrime of "menacing" former Australian of the Year Grace Tame on social media but says he is unfit to stand trial due to dementia.

title.children: Grace Tame's schoolteacher abuser argues he has dementia and can't stand trial for alleged social media harassment
